sen.j: 伊根町（いねちょう）は、京都府の町。
sen.e: Ine-cho is a town in Kyoto Prefecture.
Ine-cho is a town in Kyoto Prefecture.
Ine-cho is a town in Kyoto Prefecture.

sen.j: 丹後半島の北東部に位置し、舟屋で知られる（重要伝統的建造物群保存地区選定）。
sen.e: The town is located in the northeastern part of Tango Peninsula, and is famous for Funaya (a large cluster of traditional fishermen houses) (selected as one of the Preservation Districts for Groups of Historic Buildings).

The town is located in the northeastern part of Tango Peninsula, and is famous for Funaya (a large cluster of traditional fishermen houses) (selected as one of the Preservation Districts for Groups of Historic Buildings).

The town is located in the northeastern part of Tango Peninsula, and is famous for Funaya (a large cluster of traditional fishermen houses) (selected as one of the Preservation Districts for Groups of Historic Buildings).

sen.j: 丹後半島は古代より大陸との交流が盛んな所で、京の都と大陸との交易ルートにあたる。
sen.e: Exchanges with the Continent have been carried out actively in the Tango Peninsula, and Ine-cho was located along the trade route between the capital Kyoto and the Continent.
Exchanges with the continent of Asia were carried out actively in the Tango Peninsula, and Ine-cho was located along the trade route between the capital Kyoto and the Continent.
Exchanges with the continent of Asia were carried out actively in the Tango Peninsula, and Ine-cho was located along the trade route between the capital Kyoto and the Continent.
Fisheries and tourism are the current major industry.
Today's major industries include fishing and tourism.
Today's major industries include fishing and tourism.

sen.j: 伊根町筒川、本庄浜には浦島太郎伝説が伝わる。
sen.e: The Legend of Urashima Taro has been passed down at Honjohama beach, Ine-cho Tsutukawa.
The Legend of Urashima Taro originated and has been passed down over time from Honjohama beach, Ine-cho Tsutukawa.
The Legend of Urashima Taro originated and has been passed down over time from Honjohama beach, Ine-cho Tsutsukawa.
sen.cmt: スペルを修正しました。

tit.j: 1954年（昭和29年）11月3日 - 伊根村、朝妻村、筒川村、本庄村の4村が合併し、伊根町となる。
tit.e: November 3, 1954: Ine-cho was formed as a result of merging four villages of Ine-mura, Asazuma-mura, Tsutukawa-mura and Honjo-mura.
November 3, 1954: Ine-cho was formed as a result of merging the four villages of Ine-mura, Asazuma-mura, Tsutukawa-mura and Honjo-mura.
November 3, 1954: Ine-cho was formed as a result of merging the four villages of Ine-mura, Asazuma-mura, Tsutsukawa-mura and Honjo-mura.

sen.j: 1993年（平成5年） - 伊根の舟屋を舞台にした、連続テレビ小説『ええにょぼ』が制作される。
sen.e: 1993 - NHK Asadora Drama, "E-E-Nyobo" (A Good Wife), which was set in Ine no Funaya Houses was produced.
1993: NHK produces the Asadora Drama, "E-Nyobo" (A Good Wife), which was set in Ine no Funaya Houses.
1993: NHK produced the Asadora Drama, "Eenyobo" (A Good Wife), which was set in Ine no Funaya Houses.
sen.cmt: 過去形にしました。WebではEenyoboという表記が多数派です。

tit.j: 2005年（平成17年）4月11日 - 町役場が字平田から現位置へ移転。
tit.e: April 11, 2005: The town office was relocated from Aza-Hirata to the current place.
April 11, 2005: The town office was relocated from Aza-Hirata to its current locale.
April 11, 2005: The town office was relocated from Aza-Hirata to its current locale.

tit.j: 2007年（平成19年）12月2日 - 国道178号線養老伊根バイパス（第2工区）開通。
tit.e: December 2, 2007: Yoro-Ine bypass (second section) of National Route No. 178 was opened.
December 2, 2007: Yoro-Ine bypass (second section) of National Route No. 178 was opened.
December 2, 2007: Yoro-Ine bypass (second section) of National Route No. 178 was opened.

sen.j: 伊根町で2つ目となる信号機が完成。
sen.e: The second signal in Ine-cho was completed.
Ine-cho's second traffic signal was completed.
Ine-cho's second traffic signal was completed.

sen.j: 太鼓山、権現山(伊根町)、蝙蝠岳
sen.e: Mt. Taiko, Mt. Gongen (Ine-cho), Komori-dake (Mt. Komori)
Mt. Taiko, Mt. Gongen (Ine-cho), Komori-dake (Mt. Komori)
Mt. Taiko, Mt. Gongen (Ine-cho), Komori-dake (Mt. Komori)

sen.cmt: 町長就任期日を調べました。

Ine-cho has no airports and railroads.
Ine-cho has no airports or railroads.

sen.j: 地酒（京の春・竹の露・ええにょぼ 等）

sen.j: 水産加工品（へしこ・ぶりのみそ漬け 等）
sen.e: Processed fishery products (Heshiko (a local food of Wakasa, north of Kyoto, which is salted mackerel in rice-bran paste), Buri no misozuke (yellowtail seasoned in salty rice-bran paste), etc.)
Processed fishery products (Heshiko (a local food of Wakasa, north of Kyoto, which is salted mackerel in rice-bran paste), Buri no misozuke (yellowtail seasoned in salty rice-bran paste), etc.)
